channel.title: Making ints for Models
channel.description:
I am currently making Donator Tickets
I finished the model but I am not sure how to make the the inventory item show up as this http://prntscr.com/4y5w7j
I need someone to help me with the ints please if needed here is model(if needed) http://up.ht/1206uUN
Please help me My skype is matt.cawleynh if you want to get further into depth with this

Talking to eachother 1 hour apart is not that easy m8, and not efficiant

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’m confused…

bluedevil666:

I thought for sure that would work but the item is showing correctly do you think you can come on tv and help me?

It didn’t work but it did?

Read full topic

item.title: Making ints for Models
item.dc:creator: @bluedevil666 bluedevil666
item.description:
@bluedevil666 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:547366”]Well… Seeing as your model is not going to be worn. making ints will be easy!

My client may have different variables than yours, but here’s a mockup (note I did not actually try it in game).

case 1234:// The case for your item itemDef.modelid = 0000;// the id of the model, be careful when assigning it an id, sometimes you can overrite existing models with your new ones. (Ever seen those servers that have death capes as objects? yea? this is why.) itemDef.modelRotationY = 0;// The rotation of the model image over the y axis itemDef.modelRotationX = 0;// The rotation of the model image over the x axis itemDef.modelZoom = 1500;// How zoomed the object is. I believe higher = further. itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;// offset 1 I believe is the offset for up and down itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0;// offset 2 I believe is the offset for left and right itemDef.stackable = false;// Setting it not stackable client sided (just in case). This will remove the little '1' next to the model if it has it. Remember server sided as well.... itemDef.name = "Donator tickets";// Self explanatory... itemDef.description = "Oh look, some donator tickets.";// Self explanatory... Though you need to add the description AND name server sided too. itemDef.groundActions = new String[] { null, null, "Take", null, null };// Self explanatory... itemDef.itemActions = new String[] { null, "Wear", null, null, "Drop" };// Self explanatory... break;[/quote]

I thought for sure that would work but the item is showing correctly do you think you can come on tv and help me?

Read full topic

item.title: Making ints for Models
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well… Seeing as your model is not going to be worn. making ints will be easy!

My client may have different variables than yours, but here’s a mockup (note I did not actually try it in game).

case 1234:// The case for your item itemDef.modelid = 0000;// the id of the model, be careful when assigning it an id, sometimes you can overrite existing models with your new ones. (Ever seen those servers that have death capes as objects? yea? this is why.) itemDef.modelRotationY = 0;// The rotation of the model image over the y axis itemDef.modelRotationX = 0;// The rotation of the model image over the x axis itemDef.modelZoom = 1500;// How zoomed the object is. I believe higher = further. itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;// offset 1 I believe is the offset for up and down itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0;// offset 2 I believe is the offset for left and right itemDef.stackable = false;// Setting it not stackable client sided (just in case). This will remove the little '1' next to the model if it has it. Remember server sided as well.... itemDef.name = "Donator tickets";// Self explanatory... itemDef.description = "Oh look, some donator tickets.";// Self explanatory... Though you need to add the description AND name server sided too. itemDef.groundActions = new String[] { null, null, "Take", null, null };// Self explanatory... itemDef.itemActions = new String[] { null, "Wear", null, null, "Drop" };// Self explanatory... break;

Read full topic
